events.message: The customer filed a claim regarding a recent car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after verifying keywords related to vehicle collision and accident details.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case who specializes in auto-related claims to ensure proper handling.
The customer received acknowledgment from the insurance company that the claim was officially received and is under review.
The insurance company requested photographs of the damaged vehicle, police report, and driver's license for verification.
Customer submitted all requested documents including photos of the car damage and the official police accident report.
The investigation team began evaluating the collision details and verifying the extent of damage reported by the customer.
Investigation completed confirming that the accident was caused by another driver and coverage conditions are met.
A settlement offer for the auto repair costs was proposed to the customer based on damage assessment and policy limits.
Customer responded positively, agreeing with the proposed settlement and thanking the agent for prompt communication.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance company after final agreement on settlement terms.
Payment for the vehicle repair was issued to the customer’s bank account within the expected timeframe.
The claim was closed after full settlement payment and confirmation that customer’s vehicle repairs have been completed.
